comments.body: Would it make sense to run the full test suite ?
Yes, how do I run the full test suite?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@test:
  imports:
    - skbuild
  commands:
    - cd ${SRC_DIR} && py.test -k "not (test_push_dir or test_fortran_compiler)"    # [unix]

comments.body: Something to keep in mind is we had problems with these `x86_64` selectors recently in our maintenance scripts. ( https://github.com/conda-forge/dmd-feedstock/issues/2 ) We may need to change the feedstock not to use these.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@    - cd ${SRC_DIR} && py.test -k "not (test_push_dir or test_fortran_compiler)"    # [unix]
    - cd %SRC_DIR% && py.test -k "not (test_push_dir or test_fortran_compiler)"     # [win and not (py27 and x86_64)]
    - cd %SRC_DIR% && py.test -k "not (test_push_dir or test_fortran_compiler or test_generator_selection or test_hello_builds_with_generator)"     # [win and py27 and x86_64]
  requires:
    - pytest
